name: Perennial Cornflower
climate: Perennial Cornflowers thrive in temperate climates with seasonal changes.
They can tolerate a Mediterranean climate with dry summers and wet winters.
These plants prefer regions without extreme heat or cold extremes.
A continental climate with moderate summers and cold winters is suitable.
sunlight: Perennial Cornflowers prefer full sunlight for optimal blooming.
They can tolerate partial shade, especially during hot afternoons.
These plants require at least 6 hours of direct sunlight every day.
Bright, indirect light can be beneficial during very hot periods.
watering: Regular watering is essential, but the soil should not be waterlogged.
They need more frequent watering during hot and dry weather conditions.
The soil should be allowed to dry slightly between waterings.
Mulching can help retain moisture and reduce the frequency of watering.
soil: Perennial Cornflowers prefer well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
Sandy loam soil enriched with organic matter is ideal for growth.
They can tolerate poor soils, but richer soils promote better blooming.
The soil pH should be neutral to slightly alkaline for best results.
extra_care_tip: Deadhead spent blooms regularly to encourage continuous flowering.
Divide clumps every few years to prevent overcrowding and promote vigor.
